item.title: Of Code Smells and Hygiene
item.description: On Abstractions If you find yourself adding more parameters and if-statements to an existing abstraction, is the abstraction still apt? Why not remove the old abstraction and re-extract a new [more apt] abstraction? Devs frequently succumb to the sunken cost fallacy thinking that there must have been a reason that the code was written in a certain way. is straw-manning though. It’s less of a sunk cost fallacy, and more of a Chesterton’s Fence situation: Do not remove a fence until you know why it was put up in the first place.
